p: HIV belongs to the lentivirus subfamily of retrovirus and is the causative agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). An estimated 1.7 million individuals worldwide became newly infected with HIV in 2018; 38 million people worldwide are living with HIV and the only treatment option for these patients is antiretroviral therapy [ 106]. The presence of the virus causes a severe immunodeficiency condition, characterized by CD4 + T cell loss responsible for the onset of infections and the development of malignant tumors that otherwise rarely infect human beings to cause illness [ 107]. Two different types of HIV have been identified: HIV type 1 and HIV type 2 which differ in genome structure and geographical distribution but both cause AIDS syndrome [ 107].
